akn:section.akn:heading: Privilege against disclosure for collaborative law communication; admissibility; discovery.

akn:content.akn:p: Subject to §§ 16-4018 and 16-4019, a collaborative law communication is privileged under subsection (b) of this section, is not subject to discovery, and is not admissible as evidence.
In a proceeding, the following privileges apply:

Evidence or information that is otherwise admissible or subject to discovery does not become inadmissible or protected from discovery solely because of its disclosure or use in a collaborative law process.
